Escuche cuidadosamente para poder entender porque no aparece nada escrito en el folleto de examen para estos ejercicios. content.text: ________ hotel is where I want to stay. It’s the big one, the one just across the street.
content.name: AYVA

content.text: A)
content.name: eMOk

content.text: This
content.name: du89

content.text: B)
content.name: XdtZ

content.text: That
content.name: A79j

content.name: 0Hy0

content.text: These
content.name: ibOE

content.text: D)
content.name: eUgz

content.text: Those
content.name: dqvi

content.text: Contestación: (B)
content.name: hxWJ

content.text: Explicación: Para contestar este ejercicio es necesario determinar si el sujeto es singular o plural. En este caso, es singular “hotel”, lo cual elimina las posibilidades  (C) y (D) que son plurales. Luego debemos determinar si el hotel está cerca o lejos. Si hablamos de que el hotel está cruzando la calle, significa que está lejos, así que la única respuesta correcta es “that”.

content.text: Jamie got a new schedule this school year. It (9)_____not the one he would have preferred, but he does not hate it either. He (10)_____on getting a job, so studying during the afternoon sounded just about right. Jamie (11)______about a way of helping his family (12)____their expenses, since the financial situation has become quite complicated. Therefore, getting a part-time (13)______felt like an accurate solution for a young boy like Jamie. He (14)_______go to school during the morning time and played videogames every afternoon. By making these changes, Jamie (15)_______like to think he will be more helpful (16)____ his household and his family will be able to release some stress.

content.text: Explicación:  La oración (B) es correcta pero incompleta, ya que le falta información, al igual que la (D), que no tiene la información de cómo se sintió la abuela ayer. Las palabras en la alternativa (C) no están en orden. Solamente la alternativa (A) combina las oraciones con toda la información en el orden correcto.

content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto

content.textual:
*George went to the championship.\nHe went to the baseball championship in June.\nGeorge needs a break.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
George went in June to the baseball championship and needs to take a break.
George went to the baseball championship in June and needs to take a break.
George goes to the championship. In June he went to the baseball championship.
George went to the baseball championship in June.
b

*Reese and Malcom are intelligent.\nThey are my cousins.\nThey go to an exclusive academy.\nReese and Malcom learn languages.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Reese and Malcom go to an exclusive academy and learn languages.
They go to an exclusive academy Reese and Malcom to learn languages and they are my cousins.
My intelligent cousins Reese and Malcom go to an exclusive academy to learn languages. 
I have intelligent cousins who go to an exclusive academy to learn languages.
c

*The pets are in the backyard.\nThe pets are playing with a ball.\nThe pets are tired.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
The tired pets are in the backyard playing with a ball.
The pets are playing with a ball and tired.
The pets are in the backyard and tired.
They are playing in the backyard, and they are tired.
a

*Naomi is a doctor.\nNaomi works from Monday to Saturday.\nNaomi loves her job.\nNaomi is tired and wants to retire soon.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Naomi wants to retire from her job, and she works Monday to Saturday as a doctor.
Naomi is a doctor who works from Monday to Saturday and wants to retire soon.
Naomi, a doctor who loves her job, works from Monday to Saturday and wants to retire soon.
Naomi wants to retire soon; she is a doctor and loves her job.
c

*Joey wants to go on vacations.\nHis boss didn’t give him permission.\nHe has an important presentation this week.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
Joey wants to go on vacations, but his boss didn’t give him permission because he has an important presentation this week. 
Joey doesn’t have permission to go on vacations because he has an important presentation.
Joey wants to go on vacations but he has an important presentation this week.
Joey has an important presentation this week because he can’t go on vacations.
a

*My family saw my play.\nMy family is overjoyed.\nThey want to throw a party for me.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
My family is overjoyed and want to throw a party for me.
My family saw my play and as they are overjoyed, they want to throw a party for me.
My family wants to throw me a party because they are overjoyed.
My family and I are going to have a party because I had a nice play.
b

*The Internet is a tool.\nThe Internet provides information.\nThe Internet helps people communicate and it helps companies grow.\nThe Internet is used for a lot of different things.
Choose the alternative that is closest in meaning to the following sentences.
The Internet is a tool that provides information, helps people communicate and companies grow. It is used for a lot of different things.
The Internet is a tool that people use to communicate.
The Internet is a tool used by people to communicate and by companies to grow.
People are using the Internet because they want to communicate better and make their companies grow.
a

tvDQ

content.text:
Los ejercicios 34-40 se basan en la siguiente lectura:

La lectura va aquí:
content.name: ZflG

content.text: (1) When people are suffering from a bad breakup, they tend to go through different stages of grief. (2) The first one is “denial”, which describes the moment when the person is not ready to accept what just happened. (3)_________, it is possible you have heard about them before, so this information will not be complete new for you. (4) Next, there is “anger”; in this stage, the person is focused on _______angry this event is making her or him feel. (5) Then, we have the “bargaining” stage, where it is common to see people trying to negotiate for a different outcome. (6) Afterwards, the person may enter into a deep sadness commonly related to a “depression”. (7) Finally, in the “acceptance” stage, the person gets to feel better with the breakup and take it as it is: a real, recent event that will change her or his life.  (8) Not all stages happen at all times nor in all breakups. (9) Every person is different; therefore, every person will react differently even if they has similar circumstances than others. (10) People are always angry.
content.name: VzqE

content.text: Contestación: (C)
content.name: t4Od

content.text: Explicación: Para contestar este ejercicio es necesario leer todo el texto. Luego lea de nuevo cada una de las oraciones. El hecho de que haya personas enojadas  (oración 10) no quiere decir que las personas siempre están sintiendo enojo. Esto no es una generalidad cuando las personas tienen una ruptura amorosa ni cuando no la tienen. Por consiguiente, esa es la oración que no pertenece al texto.

content.text: Los ejercicios 10-17 se basan en la siguiente lectura:
content.name: of61

content.text: Perhaps, the Maya civilization has been the most important and
content.name: bz3H

content.text: transcendental in Mexico’s history. They were located in the southeastern of
content.name: ueTA

content.text: Mexico and northern Central America. The Mayans were quite creative and
content.name: W8Kg

content.text: smart, for instance, they standardized the calendar system into a modern
content.name: QI9c

content.text: one. They knew it was not wise to put all their eggs in one basket, so they
content.name: Vbkr

content.text: created an underground water deposit to guarantee their water supply.
content.name: rzmN

content.text: Referring to Mayan’s discoveries and creations, they really hit the nail on the
content.name: GbQL

content.text: head when they developed chocolate. When talking about Medicine,
content.name: NEAe

content.text: Mayans were particularly good at dentistry and used iron pyrite as tooth
content.name: 1Mzj

content.text: fillings. They created prosthetics made from jade and turquoise. These
content.name: mdN8

content.text: are some of the big discoveries Mayans made during their years in America,
content.name: xllK

content.text: but for sure, they are an interesting culture to know more about. A type you
content.name: iyIA

content.text: could read about once in a blue moon.
content.name: gh5L
Ck1J

content.text: Los ejercicios 18-25 se basan en la siguiente lectura:
content.name: 1aEs

content.text: It is said that our bodies speak and they do it in a louder way than words do.
content.name: z8Nj

content.text: Before we get sick, our bodies ache, that is for sure. But nowadays, we are
content.name: HT0X

content.text: committed to avoid feeling which makes it common for people to ignore pain
content.name: CO2a

content.text: and try to silence it with different types of medicines. It is hard to believe
content.name: dTZn

content.text: people are willing to put their lives in risk as if they were not the most
content.name: tNUM

content.text: valuable thing we have. Instead of listening to their headache, they take a
content.name: 0yw3

content.text: pill and keep on having the worst habits: they are sleep deprive, they do not
content.name: cYA8

content.text: pay attention to their eating schedule and they do not care about the quality
content.name: zQPM

content.text: of the ingredients they use while cooking. This is just a clear example of
content.name: ZwWH

content.text: how life goes for an average young adult. Another accurate example of
content.name: Hnc4

content.text: self-destructive behaviors is the amount of work we are willing to take for a
content.name: 9HO3

content.text: little amount of money. Yes, money is necessary, but risking your health for
content.name: I7zz

content.text: a job is not. Some people take every job opportunity they get and forget
content.name: wM1P

content.text: about actually living; exercising, spending time with their love ones, getting
content.name: MavE

content.text: new, exciting hobbies, helping those in need, etc. It is just sad to see
content.name: XQKN

content.text: how days go by without appreciating it.
content.name: SRlD
hUot

The objective of this article is: 
To inform people about diverse medicines
To give ideas
To entertain
To create awareness about the way we are currently living
D

We get to feel incomplete
Different aches and pains
Tears, non-stopping suffering
Major health problems

eating cereal and doughnuts 
paying for stuff you do not need
sleep deprivation
getting a new hobby
C

In line 10, what does “accurate” refer to?
worrying
unclear
bad
good
D

We get sick
Some headaches
Happiness

A

Words are strong
If we do not pay attention, our bodies then “scream” what they need
Bodies are difficult to understand
There is a problem with our bodies

sleep deprivation
too much work
a headache
life
D

content.text: Los ejercicios 26-33 se basan en la siguiente lectura
content.name: lJmV

content.text: In the past few years, there has been a lot of talking about Emotional
content.name: 8aPq

content.text: Intelligence (EI) and its importance. But what is it? When defining this term,
content.name: m6ql

content.text: it is safe to say that it is the ability to manage our emotions and to
content.name: 0W3K

content.text: understand the emotions around us. It sounds as something simple to do,
content.name: wixw

content.text: “easy peasy” some would say, but it is more complex than it sounds. The
content.name: h39W

content.text: cognitive (brain) processes behind feeling and acting accurately need to be
content.name: 2FV1

content.text: practiced and, in a way, trained for them to work correctly in the right
content.name: vvMu

content.text: moment. If we lack of Emotional Intelligence, we will surely not be ready to
content.name: dUHf

content.text: have healthy relationships in different fields of our lives. So, why are we so
content.name: 1qw4

content.text: focused on kids developing a good degree of EI and forgetting about
content.name: e6VO

content.text: adults around them? You cannot teach or give what you do not have and
content.name: K4p2

content.text: children nowadays are being raised and educated by people who did not
content.name: xhzC

content.text: learn about EI when they were younger. So, we have angry and confused
content.name: dgV3

content.text: adults and children who are being thought by “the wrong teachers”. What
content.name: Kcee

content.text: could a good solution be? Well, first of all, people would have to
content.name: UYv0

content.text: understand that the way they were raised has to evolved. The needs of the
content.name: MXOY

content.text: young ones are different from the ones they had during their childhood.
content.name: ZOXF

content.text: Adults need to stop pretending the new generations are wrong and they
content.name: 1Uww

content.text: need to practice some active listening. There is still a long way to go when it
content.name: RU7I

content.text: comes to EI, but people prioritizing Emotional Health during and after
content.name: bb8g

content.text: the pandemic, has given society a ray of hope. Emotional Health and
content.name: gZeJ

content.text: Emotional Intelligence include each other in their processes the whole time,
content.name: TqDs

content.text: so we must pay attention to the Emotional part of everything, before we
content.name: zIed

content.text: want to fix something else in our lives.
content.name: B7z7
2zGj

content.textual:
The article was written by:
An engineer
A psychologist
A young student
A vet
B

How does the way people develop Emotional Intelligence impact others?
High expectations about children’s EI is the problem
The way someone knows, accepts and manages his or her own feelings helps or affects negatively every interpersonal relationship
Relationships are what they are and how they are regardless your emotions
Emotional Intelligence should be developed specifically in students
B

In line 6, what does the word “cognitive” mean?
heart process
digestive system
mental processes 
other person’s point of view
C

What does the phrase “easy peasy” mean?
Something is extremely simple
Two peas in a pod
Things are always easy
People are complicated
A

Which is a cause for the lack of Emotional Intelligence? According to the article.
EI is only taught at home
EI is not important at all
Adults and kids are working together
Adults cannot teach what they do not have (in this case, EI)
D

What would happen if no one cared about Emotional Intelligence?
Relationships would get more fragile every time
Nothing 
Only adults would be in toxic relationships
Cognitive processes
A

In line 14, what does “the wrong teachers” refer to?
Teachers are wrong
Adults cannot teach youngsters and kids about EI if they do not have a good level of it themselves
Kids deserve the best teachers
Teachers are constantly mistaken
B

What’s the author’s conclusion?
Teachers are responsible for students’ EI
Emotional Health and Emotional Intelligence are practically interchangeable concepts  
Emotional Intelligence is hard to develop, but not impossible
Emotional Health and Emotional Intelligence are interconnected and should be a priority for society
D

content.text: Los ejercicios 26-33 se basan en la siguiente lectura
content.name: Gnu4

content.text: Have you ever heard the term “Special Needs”? You may also know them
content.name: mSA5

content.text: as additional needs. Well, they refer to individuals who required assistance
content.name: xLXQ

content.text: for medical, mental or psychological disabilities. A disability is defined as an
content.name: JBAk

content.text: illness, injury or condition that makes it difficult for someone to do some
content.name: s2Bn

content.text: things that other people do, and that is usually permanent or lasts for a
content.name: qdhG

content.text: long time. There are obviously big, well-prepared teams behind the research
content.name: Lx5r

content.text: of the manuals that classify these needs. Special needs are varied, they can
content.name: 2te2

content.text: range from autism, dyslexia, ADHD, Down Syndrome, blindness, movement
content.name: ko4K

content.text: difficulties, deafness, dyscalculia and more. The crucial part of this is to be
content.name: nt1F

content.text: open to inclusion. Inclusion is about, like to word says it itself, including
content.name: 46zM

content.text: a person. People with special needs have been excluded since the
content.name: 46GV

content.text: beginning of times. According to History, they were discriminated and
content.name: mrzh

content.text: diminished just because they were different. Society did not care about the
content.name: bE3b

content.text: reasons behind their diversity and they preferred to ignore their existence.
content.name: lgwn

content.text: Within time, this evolved. Society is learning about the characteristics of
content.name: 4HLZ

content.text: people with Special Needs and the value they add to our lives. Learning
content.name: 8CSj

content.text: from them and living in diversity provides us with the opportunity of
content.name: PFHx

content.text: becoming better students. For instance, it has been proven that learners
content.name: fHtv

content.text: who are formed in diverse and inclusive environments are most likely to
content.name: D0JX

content.text: succeed in Reading and Comprehension and Math. Both being subjects
content.name: y2ol

content.text: and skills that are regularly misunderstood by young learners, by being
content.name: m785

content.text: better explained, results tend to improve. Another interesting fact is that
content.name: gqgd

content.text: people who are educated in inclusive classrooms, are more patient and
content.name: E1jc

content.text: better communicators than students who are not formed in the same way.
content.name: btBy

content.text: So, it is safe to say that learners who share their days with students
content.name: 5jOo

content.text: with special needs are most likely to become better people. They get
content.name: hH1o

content.text: opportunities of developing soft skills more often. Soft Skills are those
content.name: yfJL

content.text: abilities that are more personal. They help you interact with others
content.name: svND

content.text: effectively. Some examples are communication skills, empathy, teamwork,
content.name: EZkW

content.text: flexibility, adaptability, emotional intelligence, etc. This is why schools
content.name: cmat

content.text: and parents are joining a new era in which instead of thinking how a kid
content.name: AVSz

content.text: could affect their own kid’s learning process, they are wide open to the new
content.name: r9Ls

content.text: ideas and opinions of behavioral experts: Psychologists, Psychiatrists,
content.name: oA0e

content.text: Doctors and Educators. They are all collaborating in order to create
content.name: ZjNz

content.text: awareness about Special Needs and the correlation of Inclusion and
content.name: 1iuw

content.text: Diversity to it. The benefits they have on people and the importance of
content.name: YTkG

content.text: learning about this. Nowadays, acting like “ignorance is blessed” is not what
content.name: ANdW

content.text: we are supposed to be doing anymore. Knowledge is power and this world
content.name: o7k6

content.text: is for every single person in it. We should be able to tolerate others and love
content.name: pNoA

content.text: the wealth we find in them.
content.name: tAGX
6JP8

content.textual:
What is the text about?
Habits and routines
The way we live
The learning behind Special Needs
Science 
C

What is the relationship between Special Needs and Inclusion?
By including people with Special Needs, we live in a place that accepts and loves everyone for who they are
Special Needs are Inclusion
Inclusion includes people with Special Needs
Including others is nice
A

What happened to individuals with Special Needs in the past?
They live exactly like they do now
They were angry and resentful 
No one knew anything 
They were discriminated
D

In line 37, what does the author mean with “ignorance is blessed”?
That we should be ignorant
That people think ignorance is a bless in disguised
That people were more comfortable in the past by ignoring what was happening with individuals with Special Needs 
That people love ignoring important facts
C

According to the text, what may happen to students who are not in inclusive classrooms?
They may not develop soft skills strongly
They are bad at Math
They are worse at communicating their feelings
They may live an excellent life
A

What does the word “crucial” on line 9 could be substituted for?
important
impossible
interesting
reasonable
A

In line 13, what does the author mean when he uses the word “diminished”?
To give more importance
To reduce
To include
To prefer
B

How can we develop soft skills?
By copying others
By studying Math and Science
By opening our minds and hearts to others and by practicing inclusion
By feeling envious
C

What’s the best way to avoid discrimination?
By creating awareness about other people’s needs and features and respecting and including them
By mocking others
By making small groups of friends
By reading about inclusion
A

What do Inclusion and Special Needs have in common?
They are easily confused
Inclusion is better 
They make a society better 
Special Needs are regularly ignored
C

Why can Special Needs be confusing?
Because you do not have them
Because there are a lot of different types and a big set of variety
Because we discriminate everyone
Because it depends on your personality
B

What is the message of this text?
Soft Skills are a good thing to have
Make a change in your life
To learn about diversity
Special Needs invite Inclusion to the equation and make a better society if everyone is wide open to them
D
